verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:1
verses.text: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:2
verses.text: A wise man’s heart is at his right hand; but a fool’s heart at his left.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:3
verses.text: Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:4
verses.text: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:5
verses.text: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error which proceedeth from the ruler:

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:6
verses.text: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:7
verses.text: I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon the earth.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:8
verses.text: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:9
verses.text: Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:10
verses.text: If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:11
verses.text: Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:12
verses.text: The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:13
verses.text: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:14
verses.text: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:15
verses.text: The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:16
verses.text: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:17
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:18
verses.text: By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:19
verses.text: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.

verses.name: Ecclesiastes 10:20
verses.text: Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
